burlap.behavior.valuefunction

Class ValueFunctionInitialization.ConstantValueFunctionInitialization

  • java.lang.Object
    • burlap.behavior.valuefunction.ValueFunctionInitialization.ConstantValueFunctionInitialization
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ValueFunction, ValueFunctionInitialization
    Enclosing interface:
    ValueFunctionInitialization

    public static class ValueFunctionInitialization.ConstantValueFunctionInitialization
extends java.lang.Object
implements ValueFunctionInitialization
    A ValueFunctionInitialization implementation that always returns a constant value.
    Author:
    James MacGlashan

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface burlap.behavior.valuefunction.ValueFunctionInitialization

      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      double value
      The constant value to return for all initializations.

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ValueFunctionInitialization.ConstantValueFunctionInitialization()
      Will cause this object to return 0 for all initialization values.

    • Method Detail

      • value

        public double value(State s)
        Description copied from interface: ValueFunction
        Returns the value function evaluation of the given state. If the value is not stored, then the default value specified by the ValueFunctionInitialization object of this class is returned.
        Specified by:
        value in interface ValueFunction
        Parameters:
        s - the state to evaluate.
        Returns:
        the value function evaluation of the given state.

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        a - the action for which to get the initial value of the Q-value function.
